title: Reference on Constants, Units and Uncertainty
text: constants package provides CODATA internationally recommended values fundamental physical constants, provided symbols direct use within R language. Optionally, values uncertainties /units also provided ‘errors’, ‘units’ /‘quantities’ packages installed. Committee Data Science Technology (CODATA) interdisciplinary committee International Council Science periodically provides internationally accepted set values fundamental physical constants. package contains “2018 CODATA” version, published May 2019. Eite Tiesinga, Peter J. Mohr, David B. Newell, Barry N. Taylor (2020). 2018 CODATA Recommended Values Fundamental Physical Constants (Web Version 8.1). Database developed J. Baker, M. Douma, S. Kotochigova. Available https://physics.nist.gov/cuu/Constants/, National Institute Standards Technology, Gaithersburg, MD 20899.

code: library(constants)  # the speed of light syms$c0 #> [1] 299792458 # use the constants in a local environment with(syms, c0) #> [1] 299792458  # explore which constants are available (lkp <- lookup("planck", ignore.case=TRUE)) #>        symbol                                  quantity #> 137       nah                     molar Planck constant #> 198         h                           Planck constant #> 199       hev                  Planck constant in eV/Hz #> 200      plkl                             Planck length #> 201      plkm                               Planck mass #> 202 plkmc2gev      Planck mass energy equivalent in GeV #> 203    plktmp                        Planck temperature #> 204      plkt                               Planck time #> 230      hbar                   reduced Planck constant #> 231    hbarev           reduced Planck constant in eV s #> 232   hbcmevf reduced Planck constant times c in MeV fm #>                          type        value uncertainty     unit #> 137          Physico-chemical 3.990313e-10     0.0e+00 J/Hz/mol #> 198 Universal, Adopted values 6.626070e-34     0.0e+00     J/Hz #> 199                 Universal 4.135668e-15     0.0e+00    eV/Hz #> 200                 Universal 1.616255e-35     1.8e-40        m #> 201                 Universal 2.176434e-08     2.4e-13       kg #> 202                 Universal 1.220890e+19     1.4e+14      GeV #> 203                 Universal 1.416784e+32     1.6e+27        K #> 204                 Universal 5.391247e-44     6.0e-49        s #> 230 Universal, Adopted values 1.054572e-34     0.0e+00      J*s #> 231                 Universal 6.582120e-16     0.0e+00     eV*s #> 232   Universal, Non-SI units 1.973270e+02     0.0e+00   fm*MeV idx <- as.integer(rownames(lkp))  # attach the symbols to the search path and use them explicitly attach(syms[idx]) h #> [1] 6.62607e-34 plkl #> [1] 1.616255e-35  # the same with uncertainty detach(syms[idx]) attach(syms_with_errors[idx]) h #> 6.62607(0)e-34 plkl #> 1.61626(2)e-35  # the same with units detach(syms_with_errors[idx]) attach(syms_with_units[idx]) h #> 6.62607e-34 [J/Hz] plkl #> 1.616255e-35 [m]  # the same with everything detach(syms_with_units[idx]) attach(syms_with_quantities[idx]) h #> 6.62607(0)e-34 [J/Hz] plkl #> 1.61626(2)e-35 [m]  # the whole dataset head(codata) #>     symbol                                     quantity               type #> 1      mal                          alpha particle mass Atomic and nuclear #> 2    malc2        alpha particle mass energy equivalent Atomic and nuclear #> 3 malc2mev alpha particle mass energy equivalent in MeV Atomic and nuclear #> 4     malu                     alpha particle mass in u Atomic and nuclear #> 5     mmal                    alpha particle molar mass Atomic and nuclear #> 6   malsme           alpha particle-electron mass ratio Atomic and nuclear #>          value uncertainty   unit #> 1 6.644657e-27     2.0e-36     kg #> 2 5.971920e-10     1.8e-19      J #> 3 3.727379e+03     1.1e-06    MeV #> 4 4.001506e+00     6.3e-11      u #> 5 4.001506e-03     1.2e-12 kg/mol #> 6 7.294300e+03     2.4e-07      1  # number of constants per type library(magrittr) codata %>%   tidyr::separate_rows(type, sep=", ") %>%   dplyr::count(type, sort=TRUE) #> # A tibble: 8 x 2 #>   type                   n #>   <chr>              <int> #> 1 Atomic and nuclear   173 #> 2 <NA>                  68 #> 3 Non-SI units          36 #> 4 Electromagnetic       26 #> 5 Physico-chemical      25 #> 6 Universal             16 #> 7 Adopted values        11 #> 8 X-ray values           6

title: Lists of Constants — syms
Lists of Constants — syms
text: list, names correspond symbols codata$symbol. syms contains plain numeric values. syms_with_errors contains objects type errors, enables automatic uncertainty propagation. syms_with_units contains objects type units, enables automatic conversion, derivation simplification. syms_with_quantities contains objects type quantities, combines errors units. enriched versions syms available corresponding optional packages, errors, units /quantities installed. See documentation packages information.

title: Lists of Constants — syms
text: Experimental support correlations constants provided via errors package, disabled default. enable , following option must set loading package: options(constants.correlations=TRUE) Alternatively, constants:::set_correlations() may used interactively, scripts rely non-exported function, may disappear future versions.

title: constants 1.0.1
constants 1.0.0
text: CRAN release: 2020-11-11 Update version 8.1, 2018 CODATA recommended values (#7 addressing #6). version contains breaking changes necessary streamline future updates provide stable symbol table: codata table includes absolute uncertainty instead relative one. Thus, rel_uncertainty column dropped favour new uncertainty. Also, columns slightly reordered. Symbol names constants changed. old ones hand-crafted thus unmanageable. release adopts ASCII symbols defined NIST webpage, except collide base R function. particular, two cases: c, speed light, renamed c0; sigma, Stefan-Boltzmann constant, renamed sigma0. Constant types, categories, (column codata$type) adopts names defined NIST webpage . constants belong one category (separated comma); others belong category (missing type). new features : addition codata data frame, release includes codata.cor, correlation matrix constants. addition syms_with_errors syms_with_units, new list symbols called syms_with_quantities (available optional quantities package installed), provides constant values uncertainty units. Experimental support correlated values syms_with_errors syms_with_quantities provided (disabled default; see details help(syms) activation instructions).

title: constants 0.0.2
text: CRAN release: 2018-01-08 Use units::as_units() instead deprecated units::parse_unit() (#1). Install speed light unit (#2). Unitless constants now show 1 instead unitless unit (#3). Unit Ω replaced ohm (#4).
